meanings.definition: To equip or arm with military forces.
meanings.sent1: The general militarises the soldiers before sending them to the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The country militarises its navy to protect its shores.
meanings.sent3: The chef militarises the kitchen with pots and pans for the busy dinner service.
meanings.sent4: The artist militarises the canvas with bold strokes of color.
meanings.sent5: The teacher militarises the classroom with educational tools for the students.

meanings.definition: To organize or prepare for war.
meanings.sent1: The king militarises his troops for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent2: The government militarises the country's defenses in times of conflict.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels militarise their acorn stash for the long winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds militarise the sky before the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The coach militarises the team for the championship game.

meanings.definition: To make military in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The uniform militarises the look of the soldiers on parade.
meanings.sent2: The camouflage pattern militarises the design of the backpack.
meanings.sent3: The clown militarises his outfit with oversized boots and a silly hat.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds militarise the peaceful sky.
meanings.sent5: The music militarises the atmosphere of the action movie.
